page.title: 07The Local Maternity Hospital
page.content: The William Smellie in Lanark is the local Maternity Hospital. Mothers from quite far away come to the hospital. William Smellie was a famous gynaecologist who lived in the late seventeenth century and early eighteenth century. The hospital which was built in 1897, originally belonged to the Lockhart family who donated their home as a hospital. There have been extensions built, and in all, there are fifty two rooms. there are about fifty babies born each week in the hospital. Caesarian operations are not very common, only about eight per cent of the births. The average time for a mother and child to stay in hospital is five days, all going well. Not very many nurses live on the premises but some do. fathers can stay at the birth if they want to, the hospital encourages this.
